After high school, Jon pursued his passion for the arts, enrolling in the prestigious Juilliard School in New York City. Upon graduation, Jon began landing small roles on Broadway and in Off-Broadway productions, gradually building a reputation as a talented young actor.

In the 1960s, Jon made the transition to film, securing a string of critically acclaimed roles in counterculture classics such as "Easy Rider" (1969), "Midnight Cowboy" (1969), and "Zabriskie Point" (1970). Throughout the 1970s and 1980s, Jon continued to dazzle audiences with memorable turns in films like "Coming Home" (1978), "The Champ" (1979), and "Lookin' to Get Out" (1982). Today, Jon Voight remains an active and respected figure in the entertainment industry, with a career spanning over five decades.
